snippet: As Christians ask how their faith requires them to treat animals, they may force animal rights activists, a mostly secular lot, to reconsider their views on Christians.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column; animal welfare has become lively topic among Christians in United States and England, who cite their view that animals are God's creations and should be treated accordingly; viewpoint may force animal rights activists, typically a secular lot, to reconsider how they view Christians.
lead_paragraph: As Christians ask how their faith requires them to treat animals, they may force animal rights activists, a mostly secular lot, to reconsider their views on Christians.

headline.print_headline: Scholars Explore Christian Perspectives on Animal Rights
headline.main: Scholars Explore Christian Perspectives on Animal Rights
